title: A strengthening of McConnel's theorem on permutations over finite fields
abstract:
Let $p$ be a prime, $q=p^n$, and $D \subset \mathbb{F}_q^*$. A celebrated
result of McConnel states that if $D$ is a proper subgroup of $\mathbb{F}_q^*$,
and $f:\mathbb{F}_q \to \mathbb{F}_q$ is a function such that
$(f(x)-f(y))/(x-y) \in D$ whenever $x \neq y$, then $f(x)$ necessarily has the
form $ax^{p^j}+b$. In this notes, we give a sufficient condition on $D$ to
obtain the same conclusion on $f$. In particular, we show that McConnel's
theorem extends if $D$ has small doubling.
